info.name: Aberrant Arachnid Trail
info.description: Aberrant Arachnid Trail (Arachnid Hunter’s) for Madwalker class from Tanares RPG
info.author: Dragori Games

description.p: Madwalkers that follow this path are not only feared but also hated by the Arachness. The gruesome ritual they undergo attunes them to the energies of Ungods and the Arachnees, harnessing their vicious powers by taking the heart of an Arachne, a price paid willingly for power.

These Madwalkers move through the shadows, sensing and manipulating the chaotic vibrations of the Penumbral Plane, blades dripping with deadly poison, and hands weaving sticky webs that ensnare prey. They feed off their victim’s fear, savoring the scent of terror that fills the air before they strike with unmatched intensity and aggression.

Their transformations are an affront to all that is natural, becoming horrid, fearsome exemplars of cunning and viciousness. The resulting humanoid-spider hybrids are chaotic deadly creatures that send shivers down the spine of even the bravest warriors, their presence alone an omen of a horrible fate. These Madwalkers revel in their sinister powers, embracing their chaos and savoring the taste of their prey’s terror as they move through the shadows, always aware of the price they pay for their power.
With their senses attuned to the deep hunger of the spiders, the Madwalkers that follow this path move through the Penumbral Plane as deadly predators, always on the hunt for their next victim.

As an Aberrant Arachnid Trail madwalker, you have access to various exclusive Aberrant Mutations acquired at 2nd, 5th, 9th, 13th, and 17th madwalker levels. Upon gaining each of these levels, you may choose one of the available Aberrant Mutations, and it does not count toward the number of Aberrant Mutations known.
You embody the agility and predatory instincts of a spider.

At 2nd level, while wearing light or no armor and without a shield, your Armor Class (AC) increases by 1. In addition, every time you engage in a melee attack against a creature with no allies within a 5-foot radius, you gain temporary hit points equal to your madwalker level. These hit points last for a minute and are granted even if the attack fails. They don’t stack. Starting from the 5th level, you add your proficiency bonus to your level when obtaining these temporary hit points.

sheet.description: While wearing light or no armor and without a shield, your Armor Class (AC) increases by 1. In addition, every time you engage in a melee attack against a creature with no allies within a 5-foot radius, you gain temporary hit points equal to your madwalker level. These hit points last for a minute and are granted even if the attack fails. They don’t stack. Starting from the 5th level, you add your proficiency bonus to your level when obtaining these temporary hit points.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level, you have access to penumbral shapes exclusive to the Aberrant Arachnid Trail.
Starting at 7th level, you gain poison immunity and a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. This allows you to traverse walls and ceilings hands-free.

Additionally, when you suffer damage from an attack, you can react by moving up to 20 feet. If you end your movement in an area that offers total cover or is heavily obscured, you can hide as part of this reaction.

sheet.description: When you suffer damage from an attack, you can react by moving up to 20 feet. If you end your movement in an area that offers total cover or is heavily obscured, you can hide as part of this reaction.

description.p: Starting at the 14th level, once per long rest, you can spend 10 minutes to weave a mystical web around you. This creates a up to 50-foot radius circular area that must be anchored between at least two solid masses as the web spell. Creatures oblivious to the web must make a Wisdom (Perception) check against your Dexterity (Stealth) check to spot it before entering its area.

You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks within this area. Furthermore, if you’re in contact with the web, you can sense all creatures that touch or move through it, thus, they can’t surprise you.

For all other creatures, the web is difficult terrain. If they move or end their turn on the web, they must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 20) once per turn. If they fail, they become restrained and stuck in the web. At the end of each turn, the restrained creature can attempt a Strength saving throw (DC 20) to break free from the web. The web lasts for 8 hours.

sheet.description: Once per long rest, you can spend 10 minutes to weave a mystical web around you. This creates a up to 50-foot radius circular area that must be anchored between at least two solid masses as the web spell. Creatures oblivious to the web must make a Wisdom (Perception) check against your Dexterity (Stealth) check to spot it before entering its area. You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks within this area. Furthermore, if you’re in contact with the web, you can sense all creatures that touch or move through it, thus, they can’t surprise you. For all other creatures, the web is difficult terrain. If they move or end their turn on the web, they must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 20) once per turn. If they fail, they become restrained and stuck in the web. At the end of each turn, the restrained creature can attempt a Strength saving throw (DC 20) to break free from the web. The web lasts for 8 hours.

description.p: Starting at the 18th level, once per short rest, you can use an action to become invisible for a minute or until you decide to reveal yourself. Any creature trying to detect you while you’re invisible in this way have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) check. This invisibility isn’t interrupted by attacking.

sheet.description: Once per short rest, you can use an action to become invisible for a minute or until you decide to reveal yourself. Any creature trying to detect you while you’re invisible in this way have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) check. This invisibility isn’t interrupted by attacking.

description.p: The arachne serf makes two Claw attacks.

sheet.description: The arachne serf makes two Claw attacks.

description.p: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

sheet.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

description.p: The creature has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

sheet.description: The creature has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

description.p: The creature can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

sheet.description: The creature can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

description.p: While in contact with a web, the creature knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

sheet.description: While in contact with a web, the creature knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

description.p: The creature ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing

sheet.description: The creature ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing

description.p: The arachne scout makes two Claw attacks.

sheet.description: The arachne scout makes two Claw attacks.

description.p: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

sheet.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

description.p: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. Hit: The target is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a DC 12 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

description.p: The arachne sorcerer casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks):

ul.li: At will: charm person, mage hand, poison spray
3/day each: sleep, fear, invisibility, see invisibility

sheet.description: Charisma caster with DC 14 and +6 to hit. - At will: charm person, mage hand, poison spray - 3/day each: sleep, fear, invisibility, see invisibility - 1/day each: dimensional door

description.p: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage. A creature hit must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute.

sheet.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage. A creature hit must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute.

description.p: The arachne noble sprays magic poison gas in a 40-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) poison damage and being poisoned on a failed save, or half as much damage and not getting poisoned on a successful one. At the end of each of its turns, a poisoned target can make a Constitution saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

sheet.description: The creature can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

description.p: While in contact with a web, the creature knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

sheet.description: While in contact with a web, the creature knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

description.p: The creature ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing

sheet.description: The creature ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing
